page.title: 02ST.MICHAEL'S MOUNT HISTORY-1
page.content: For approximately 300 years before the birth of Christ, the Mount was a{port and trading market}dealing in Cornish tin. The original{Domesday Book}says that the Mount was dedicated to St. Michael and belonged to a priest named Brismar at the time of King Edward the Confessor. In 1135 the abbot of Mont.St.Michel in Normandy built a{priory}on St. Michael's Mount. There were strong links between the two religious communities for many years. St. Michael's Mount was a famous place of pilgrimage throughout the Middle Ages. After the dissolution of the monasteries the Mount became a {garrison.}It was one of the beacons which signalled the approach of the Spanish Armada in 1587.
